column4: okay, followed the grub instructions and it seemed to complete successfully. However, when I used the instructions to view the menu.lst I got a blank file. When I look at the partition I know is the boot drive, I see no menu.lst.
I work mostly in a Windows world and gotta tell ya, Vista blows chunks.
why?  To me, vista is probably the best thing MS has done since win 2k
if you use nVidia, yeah, but blaming vista for that is like blaming linux for the ati problems
